derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: perhaps from badge, with reference to its distinctive head markings. The verb sense (late 18th cent.) originates from the formerly popular sport of badger-baiting

entry.def: A badger is a wild animal which has a white head with two wide black stripes on it. Badgers live underground and usually come up to feed at night.
If you badger someone, you repeatedly tell them to do something or repeatedly ask them questions.

example.ex: She badgered her doctor time and again, pleading with him to do something...
example.tran: 她屡屡缠着她的医生不放，求他做点什么。

example.ex: They kept phoning and writing, badgering me to go back...
example.tran: 他们不停地给我打电话、写信，软磨硬泡要我回去。

means.word_mean: 1. sturdy carnivorous burrowing mammal with strong claws widely distributed in the northern hemisphere

sentences.sentence: "The children teased the boy because of his stammer"

example.en: I've seen through your badger game. I won't be taken in.
example.zh: 我已经识破你们设下的美人计了。我不会上当的。

sentences.en: The sharp sound of a twig snapping scared the badger away.
sentences.cn: 细枝突然折断的刺耳声把獾惊跑了。

sentences.en: Badgers had undermined the foundations of the church.
sentences.cn: 獾在这座教堂的地基处打了洞。

sentences.en: The badger sett had twelve entrances to what must have been a labyrinth of tunnels.
sentences.cn: 这个獾穴有12 个入口，下面必定有一套错综复杂的地道。

means.word_mean: 纠缠不休, 烦扰, 吵着要

sentences.en: My girlfriend badgered me to buy a necklace for her.
sentences.cn: 我的女朋友纠缠着要我给她买一条项链。

sentences.en: The children badgered me into taking them to the cinema.
sentences.cn: 孩子们吵着要我带他们去看电影。

sentences.en: They badgered me into buying a new car.
sentences.cn: 他们缠得我只好买一辆新汽车。
